enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Thursday, the third day of January, two thousand and thirteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may jointly designate, the 28th Annual District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run (in this resolution referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate

term.#tail: ) may be run through the Capitol Grounds to carry the Special Olympics torch to honor local Special Olympics athletes.

text.#text: On September 27, 2013, or on such other date as the

header.#text: Authorization of use of the Capitol grounds for DC Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take such actions as may be necessary to carry out the event.
may prescribe conditions for physical preparations for the event.
shall provide for enforcement of the restrictions contained in
, concerning sales, advertisements, displays, and solicitations on the Capitol Grounds, as well as other restrictions applicable to the Capitol Grounds, in connection with the event.

role.#text: Clerk of the House of Representatives.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: HCON 44 ENR: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.
